speaker: Doctor
text: What other symptoms are you experiencing besides swelling and pain in your right ring finger?

speaker: Patient
text: I can't flex my right ring finger at the distal joint when I make a fist, and it hurts a lot at that joint. My finger also stays extended when I'm resting.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any recent injuries or trauma to your right hand or finger?

speaker: Patient
text: Yes, I injured my right ring finger two days ago while playing football. It got caught in another player's jersey, and he pulled away forcefully. That's when the pain and swelling started.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any bruising or discoloration around the injured area?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't noticed any bruising or discoloration around my right ring finger. It's mostly just swollen and painful.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any numbness or tingling in your right hand or fingers since the injury?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't experienced any numbness or tingling in my right hand or fingers since the injury. It's just the pain and swelling in my right ring finger.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you been able to move your other fingers normally, or do you have any pain or limitations in them as well?

speaker: Patient
text: I've been able to move my other fingers normally without any pain or limitations. It's just my right ring finger that's causing all the issues.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you tried any treatments for the pain and swelling, such as ice, elevation, or over-the-counter pain medication?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't tried any treatments yet. I've just been resting it and avoiding using my right hand as much as possible.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in the range of motion of your right ring finger since the injury, aside from the inability to flex at the distal joint?

speaker: Patient
text: I can’t flex my right ring finger at the distal joint, and it feels stiff overall. I haven't been able to move it much since the injury.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any swelling in other parts of your hand or body, or is it localized only to the right ring finger?

speaker: Patient
text: The swelling is localized only to my right ring finger. I haven't noticed any swelling in other parts of my hand or body.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any fever or chills since the injury?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't experienced any fever or chills since the injury. It's just the pain and swelling in my right ring finger.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any previous injuries to your right hand or fingers in the past?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't had any previous injuries to my right hand or fingers. This is the first time I've experienced something like this.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any popping or clicking sounds when you try to move your right ring finger?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't noticed any popping or clicking sounds when I try to move my right ring finger. It just feels stiff and painful.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any swelling or pain in your wrist or forearm on the same side?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't experienced any swelling or pain in my wrist or forearm. The discomfort is only in my right ring finger.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you been able to bear weight on your right hand, or does it cause you pain when you try to use it?

speaker: Patient
text: It causes me pain when I try to use my right hand, so I've been avoiding putting any weight on it. I mostly just keep it rested.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in the color or temperature of your right ring finger compared to your other fingers?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't noticed any changes in color or temperature in my right ring finger compared to my other fingers. It feels similar in temperature, but it's just swollen and painful.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any difficulty with gripping or holding objects with your right hand since the injury?

speaker: Patient
text: Yes, I've had difficulty gripping or holding objects with my right hand since the injury. It hurts too much to use my right ring finger effectively.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in the shape of your right ring finger, such as any deformity or abnormal positioning?

speaker: Patient
text: I haven't noticed any obvious deformity, but my right ring finger does stay extended when I'm resting, which feels unusual. It just looks swollen compared to my other fingers.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you experienced any pain when you press on the swollen area of your right ring finger?

speaker: Patient
text: Yes, pressing on the swollen area of my right ring finger definitely causes pain. It feels tender to the touch, especially around the joint.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you had any previous medical conditions or surgeries related to your hands or fingers?

speaker: Patient
text: No, I haven't had any previous medical conditions or surgeries related to my hands or fingers. This injury is the first issue I've had.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you noticed any changes in your ability to perform daily activities, such as typing or writing, since the injury?

speaker: Patient
text: Yes, I've noticed it’s difficult to type or write because I can't use my right ring finger properly. It causes pain when I try to press down on the keys or hold a pen.

speaker: Doctor
text: Based on your symptoms and the mechanism of injury, it sounds like you may have a tendon injury, possibly a rupture of the flexor tendon in your right ring finger. I would like to confirm this with an imaging test. REQUEST TEST: Ultrasound of the right ring finger.

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS
